com.thomsonreuters.upa.perftools.common

Class ProviderThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • com.thomsonreuters.upa.perftools.common.ProviderThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IProviderThread, NIProviderThread

    public class ProviderThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    ProviderThreads are used to control individual threads. Each thread handles providing data to its open channels.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

      • cleanup

      • getItemMsgBuffer

        public int getItemMsgBuffer(ProviderSession session,
                            int length,
                            com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Error error)
        Gets a TransportBuffer for encoding a message. This method handles packing of messages, if packing is configured -- it will pack as long as appropriate, stopping to write if the present buffer is too full to accommodate the requested length.
        Parameters:
        session - - Channel session to get transport buffer from
        length - - buffer size to get
        error - - error populated when get transport buffer fails
        Returns:
        <0 if get buffer fails, 0 otherwise.

      • sendItemMsgBuffer

        public int sendItemMsgBuffer(ProviderSession session,
                             boolean allowPack,
                             com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Error error)
        Sends a completed transport buffer. This method packs messages, if packing is configured. The allowPack option may be used to prevent packing if needed(for example, we just encoded the last message of a burst so it is time to write to the transport).
        Parameters:
        session - - client channel session
        allowPack - - if false, write buffer without packing. if true, pack according to configuration.
        error - - error information populated in case of failure.
        Returns:
        <0 in case of error, 0 otherwise
